This repository serves as a **dynamic technical portfolio** and resume for **Noelia Calvente Garc√≠a**, an expert in **NLP Engineering** and **Localization (EN<>ES)**.

---

## üìÑ Professional Summary

Highly specialized hybrid professional focused on the implementation of **Generative AI (GenAI)** models applied to **Localization** and **Technical Translation**. I combine a strong linguistic foundation with **Deep Learning** expertise to optimize the quality, speed, and consistency of content workflows.

### üéØ Areas of Expertise

| Area | Key Experience | Tools & Frameworks |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **NLP & GenAI Engineering** | **LLM Fine-tuning**, Design and implementation of **RAG Systems** (LangChain), Neural Machine Translation (NMT) Pipeline Development with **PyTorch**. | **PyTorch**, **LangChain**, Hugging Face, Python, TensorFlow. |
| **Localization & LQA** | Terminological Management, Linguistic Quality Assurance (**LQA**), Video Game Transcreation (e.g., *Wuthering Waves*), Cultural adaptation, and technical tag handling. | SDL Trados Studio, MemoQ, **spaCy**, AntConc. |
| **Development & DevOps** | Scripting with Python/JavaScript, SQL database management, Containerization (**Docker**), and familiarity with Cloud architectures (Azure/GCP). | Python, JavaScript, SQL, Docker, GitHub. |

## üíº Relevant Professional Experience

### Punda Translations | December 2024 ‚Äì May 2025
**Curricular & Extracurricular Internship: Localizer / Linguistic Tester (LQA)**
* Led **LQA** and multilingual terminology management during video game localization (e.g., *Wuthering Waves*), ensuring linguistic coherence in technical environments with dynamic variables.
* Applied CAT tools and contextual analysis for the transcreation of narrative and promotional content.

### CBLINGUA S. L. | June 2024
**Curricular Internship: Translator / Linguistic Assistant**
* Translation (EN > ES) of academic, legal, and economic documents. Applied CAT tools for terminology management and stylistic consistency.

## üí° Research & Technical Achievements

* **Final-Year Project (M.A. in Translation and Interculturality):** Analysis of the impact of AI (NMT, generative models) on **literary translation**. Demonstrated AI limitations in stylistic equivalence. **Awarded Grade: 10/10 (Distinction ‚Äì Honor Mention).**
* **Invited Speaker ‚Äì University of Seville:** Delivered a talk on the feminization and transcreation of diegetic elements, analyzing translation strategies assisted by **AI and human expertise**.
* **Final-Year Project (B.A. in English Philology):** Corpus study comparing **Riot Games** vs. players' jargon for video game localization strategies. **Awarded Grade: 10/10.**

---

## üìÅ Featured Projects (See Pinned Repositories)

Visit my pinned repositories for detailed code and implementation of the following technical projects:

1.  **`LLM_RAG_Localization_Tools`**: Implementation of a RAG system to provide terminological context to LLMs, optimizing accuracy in translation suggestions for LQA pipelines.
2.  **`PyTorch_NMT_Prototype`**: A prototype Neural Machine Translation (NMT) model developed with native PyTorch, demonstrating mastery in building Transformer-based architectures.
3.  **`LQA_Automation_Scripts`**: Collection of Python scripts utilizing NLP libraries (spaCy/NLTK) to automate the detection of common errors in localization files.
